headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Intel, Nvidia, Micron, Novo Nordisk, 89bio, CrowdStrike, Bullish, Nucor, and More
summary: Stocks rose to fresh records Thursday after the Federal Reserve, as expected, trimmed interest rates by a quarter-point and signaled it could make two additional cuts this year.  Intel  soared 23% to $30.57 after Nvidia said it would invest $5 billion in Intel at a purchase price of $23.28 a share as part of an agreement that will see the technology companies co-develop “multiple generations of custom data center and PC products.”  Rival chip makers  Advanced Micro Devices  and  Arm Holdings  were down 0.8% and 4.5%, respectively, while U.S.-listed shares of  Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing  were up 2.2%.

headline: Why Nucor (NUE) Ranks Among the Best Performing in 2025 Dividend Stocks
summary: Nucor Corporation (NYSE:NUE) is included among the 15 Best Performing Dividend Stocks So Far in 2025. Nucor Corporation (NYSE:NUE) is a North Carolina-based company that produces steel and related products. The company produces about a quarter of all raw steel made in the US. Its wide product lineup includes bars, beams, sheets, plates, grating, fasteners, […]

headline: Stocks to Watch Thursday: Nvidia, PayPal, Meta
summary: ↗️ Nvidia (NVDA): The chip giant's shares staged a recovery in premarket trading. The stock sold off Wednesday after China effectively blacklisted a new Nvidia AI chip. Other semiconductor stocks such as Broadcom (AVGO) also climbed before the bell.

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Intel, Nvidia, Micron, Novo Nordisk, Tesla, Nucor, Bullish, Cracker Barrel, and More
summary: Stock futures were rising Thursday after the Federal Reserve, as expected, trimmed interest rates by a quarter-point and signaled it could make two additional cuts this year.  Stocks rallied initially Wednesday f0llowing the Fed’s decision but finished the trading day mixed.  Intel  soared 30% to $32.25 after Nvidia said it would invest $5 billion in Intel at a purchase price of $23.28 a share as part of an agreement that will see the technology companies co-develop “multiple generations of custom data center and PC products.”.
